settings.faq_question: Are Ina Paarman products suitable for Vegetarians/Vegans?
settings.faq_answer: Ina Paarman offers a range of products, and while some may be suitable for vegetarians, others may contain animal-derived ingredients. For vegans, it is recommended to check the product label carefully, as certain items may contain dairy or other non-vegan ingredients. Always refer to the ingredient list on the packaging or visit our website for detailed product information.

settings.faq_question: Can I microwave sauces in the packs?
settings.faq_answer: No, we do not recommend microwaving the sauces in their original packaging. The packaging is not designed to withstand microwave heat. Please transfer the sauce to a microwave-safe container before heating.
Yes, bulk purchases of Ina Paarman products are available for certain products. For more details or to place a bulk order, please contact our sales team or visit our wholesale section on the website.

settings.faq_question: Do you have an allergen policy?
settings.faq_answer: Yes, Ina Paarman takes allergens seriously, and all products clearly indicate any potential allergens such as dairy, nuts, soy, and gluten. Please always check the product packaging for allergen information, or consult our website for detailed allergen policies.

settings.faq_question: How long can I keep Ina Paarman products once they have been opened?
settings.faq_answer: Once opened, it is best to refrigerate Ina Paarman products and use them within the time indicated on the packaging. Generally, sauces and dressings should be consumed within 4 to 6 weeks of opening. Always follow the storage instructions for the best results.

settings.title: Alcohol Substitution
settings.description:
Amaretto

Italian almond-flavored liqueur

substitute with:

Almond extract

Beer or Ale

Various types

substitute with:

For light beers, substitute chicken broth, ginger ale or white grape juice. For heavier beers, use a stronger beef, chicken or mushroom broth or stock.

Calvados

Apple brandy

substitute with:

Apple juice concentrate or juice.

Champagne

Sparkling white wine

substitute with:

Sparkling white grape juice.

Coffee Liqueur

Coffee Liqueur

substitute with:

To replace 2 tablespoons of liqueur, use ½ to 1 teaspoon of chocolate extract mixed with 1 teaspoon of instant coffee, which has been mixed with 2 tablespoons of water. Can also substitute with espresso.
